sentences.en: He could not understand what strange emotion distracted him.
sentences.cn: 他弄不明白是什么奇怪的感情搅得他这样心烦意乱.

sentences.en: He was distracted between two objects.
sentences.cn: 他被这两件东西所迷惑.

sentences.en: He was distracted with an unhappy love affair.
He was one of my most able pupils, but far too easily distracted by frivolities.
sentences.cn: 他是我最有才华的学生之一，只是太容易被一些无聊的事分心。

sentences.en: I can't let myself be distracted by those things.
sentences.cn: 我不能因为那些事情让自己分神。

sentences.en: I'm nearly distracted, Nelly, she exclaimed, throwing herself on the sofa.
sentences.cn: 我快神经错乱啦,耐莉, 她嚷道, 扑到沙发上.
卢克似乎一时心不在焉.

sentences.en: Papa seemed distracted, but he whirled her around the floor expertly.
sentences.cn: 爸爸有些心不在焉, 但他熟练地带着她在地板上旋转.
她看上去好像心烦意乱，真奇怪。

sentences.en: She was distracted with grief and refused to be solaced.
sentences.cn: 她悲痛得精神恍惚,怎麽安慰也没用.

sentences.en: She was unpredictable, explosive, impulsive and easily distracted.
sentences.cn: 她难以捉摸，脾气暴躁，冲动鲁莽，容易分心。

sentences.en: The noise made by the children outside distracted me from my reading.
sentences.cn: 外面孩子们的吵闹声使我不能专心读书.

sentences.en: When working, one should concentrate and not allow oneself to be distracted.
sentences.cn: 工作时要集中精力,不要分心.

sentences.en: Whoever was being driven distracted, it was not he. He was sane.
sentences.cn: 要是有人被逼疯, 必不是他. 他神智清醒.

sentences.en: You distract me. I've been distracted since the moment I met you. Because all I can think about is how much I want to kiss you.
sentences.cn: 你害我分心。从遇见你的那一刻起，你就让我分心。因为我的脑海里满满都是想吻你的冲动。

words.tran_cn: 注意力分散；消遣；心烦意乱

trans.tran_cn: 思想不集中的，心烦意乱的，遭受矛盾的感情的
trans.tran_en: anxious and unable to think clearly

trans.tran_cn: 使分心(distract的过去式和过去分词)
